title: Ensuring Continued Accountability in Federal Hiring
summary: Executive Order 14356, issued on October 15, 2025, aims to maintain accountability in federal hiring. The order highlights significant reductions in the federal workforce over the past eight months, with a focus on national security, immigration enforcement, and public safety. Key policies include compliance with the Merit Hiring Plan, establishment of Strategic Hiring Committees, and the creation of Annual Staffing Plans. Exceptions are noted for certain positions and agencies, and a joint report on implementation is required within 180 days. The order emphasizes compliance with applicable laws and prohibits circumventing its intent through external contracting.
